results.title: A Good Eye for Story
results.credit_line:
Filmed in Mbantua (Alice Springs)
Equipment provided by Panavision Australia
Colour by Matt Fezz
Special thanks to CAAMA Productions
results.material_description: Single-channel video, HDMI 4k video projection, 16:9, colour, sound, 3:06 min
results.brief_description: Dylan River’s film A Good Eye for Story is a quirky and intimate picture looking at the framework for which he shares his ideas and the impact that his family, community and the landscape around Alice Springs have had on his growing practice as a storyteller.

constellations_other.name: Arrkutja Tharra, Kungka Kutjara, Two Girls
constellations_other.description: Arrkutja Tharra, Kungka Kutjara, Two Girls explores the reality of living in Mparntwe (Alice Springs) through the eyes of the artists, who grew up there. Place and Indigenous representation are also vital to the other works in this Constellation.

results.headline_credit_for_label:
filmed in Mbantua (Alice Springs)

Equipment provided by Panavision Australia

Colour by Matt Fezz
results.description:
Dylan River is a filmmaker who shares stories from his unique perspective as a Kaytetye man. River works across many roles including cinematography, directing, and writing, for web series, documentary, short film, and cinema.

River’s film A Good Eye for Story is a quirky and intimate picture looking at the framework for which he shares his ideas and the impact that his family, community and the landscape around Alice Springs have had on his growing practice as a storyteller.

“This film explores my journey over the past ten years of being behind the cinema camera. The way my eye has changed from looking at images as being formulaic to appreciating the story behind every one.” – Dylan River
description_for_label:
Dylan River is a filmmaker who shares stories from his unique perspective as a Kaytetye man. River works across many roles including cinematography, directing, and writing, for web series, documentary, short film, and cinema.

River’s film A Good Eye for Story is a quirky and intimate picture looking at the framework for which he shares his ideas and the impact that his family, community and the landscape around Alice Springs have had on his growing practice as a storyteller.

“This film explores my journey over the past ten years of being behind the cinema camera. The way my eye has changed from looking at images as being formulaic to appreciating the story behind every one.” – Dylan River

results.title: A Grain of sand
results.creator_credit: David Keith Hardy, John Luck and UNICEF
results.brief_description: Firstly children’s needs are dramatised through a poem by William Blake and drawings by Ronald Searle. Then we follow a 10 year old Tunisian Arab boy to a health clinic, a school and a vocational training centre - three concrete ways to help meet children’s needs.

results.title: A Gift for Kate
results.creator_credit: John Smith, Barrie Howells, Sam Grana, Robert Fortier and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Kate is a recently discharged mental patient who now lives in a run-down halfway house. The weekly visits from her fifteen-year-old son, Arthur, are bright spots in her difficult life. For Arthur, who has trouble dealing with his mother’s condition, the visits are difficult. Arthur’s embarrassment and confusion lead him to lie to his girlfriend about Kate, with some surprising results when the two women meet.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Smith, Barrie Howells, Sam Grana, Robert Fortier and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: A Generation = Pokolenie
results.creator_credit: Andrzej Wajda, Ignacy Taub and Zespol Filmowy KADR
results.brief_description:
The first of Wajda’s unplanned war trilogy (with “Kanal” and “Ashes and Diamonds”) offers a strikingly unsentimental appraisal of heroism in this tale of a cocky Polish youth who decides to fight the Nazis after he falls for a pretty Resistance leader. Barely out of their teens, he and his brash friends approach their first mission - to help escapees during the Warsaw gheto uprising - like a game of cops and robbers. Inevitably the game turns deadly and the innocence of a generation is lost under the gruelling conditions of war. Adapted by Bohdan Czeszko from his novel. In Polish with English sub-titles.
Cast includes Roman Polanski

results.title: A Friend at the door
results.creator_credit: Leslie McFarlane, James Beveridge and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This is a story of how rural social workers in British Columbia cover a large and rugged province, and of the ways in which they help people in many kinds of trouble to solve their problems. Taking four cases - a pensioner, a youngster in juvenile court, an unmarried mother and a family distressed by the threat of illness and poverty - the film describes how each case is investigated, and how people in need are put in touch with available aid, both government and private.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leslie McFarlane, James Beveridge and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: A Fistful of dynamite = Giu la testa
results.creator_credit: Sergio Leone, Fulvio Morsella, Euro International and Rafan Cinematografica
results.brief_description: Set in the time of the Mexican revolution, Juan (Rod Steiger), a leader of a gang of bandits, meets an IRA explosives expert, Sean Mallory (James Coburn) who is on the run in Mexico to avoid detention by the British. Juan wants Sean to use his explosives skills to help rob a bank but Sean is taken by the cause of the revolutionaries and gets involved with them. A fine example of the spaghetti western: a Ennio Morricone soundtrack, direction by Sergio Leone and great use of widescreen vistas all topped off with action and gritty characters. Cast includes Romolo Valli.

results.title: A Fistful of dollars = Per un pugno di dollari [Widescreen] (S)
results.creator_credit: Sergio Leone, George Papi, Harry Colombo and Jolly Film
results.brief_description: Clint Eastwood plays a cynical gunfighter who comes to a small border town and offers his services to two rivalling gangs. Neither gang is aware of his double play, and each thinks it is using him, but the stranger will outwit them both. This picture was the first instalment in a cycle commonly known as the “Dollars” trilogy, with “For a Few Dollars More” and “The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly” as follow-ups. Although the plot was admittedly borrowed from Kurosawa’s “Yojimbo”, the film contains all of Leone’s trademarks; taciturn characters, precise framing, extreme close-ups, and the haunting music of Ennio Morricone. Cast includes Marianne Koch, John Wells, W. Lukschy and Josef Egger.

results.title: A Fish called Wanda
results.creator_credit: Charles Crichton, Michael Shamberg and Prominent Features
results.brief_description: The culture clash between the English and Americans is the subject of this offbeat romantic caper, written by John Cleese and directed by veteran Charles Crichton. The “Yanks” are Wanda (Jamie Lee Curtis) and her lover/partner in crime, Otto (Kevin Kline). The “Brits” are barrister, Archie Leach (John Cleese) and Ken (Michael Palin), a stuttering animal rights activist and criminal. A diamond heist brings them together, as they all attempt to confiscate the hidden loot behind each others backs. A romantic quadrangle adds to the fun.

results.title: A Fight for breath: emphysema
results.creator_credit: Joe Licastro, Floyd Elliott and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film aimed at youngsters tempted by cigarettes but also for all those already addicted. Why a man suffering from emphysema has difficulty breathing is graphically illustrated. The entire respiratory system is shown in animated cross-sectional models, down to the smallest air cells, the alveoli. That is where the breakdown begins that eventually leads to impaired pulmonary function. This internal view of the damage done to the lungs is one that no viewer can ignore.

results.title: A Figgy Duff Christmas
results.creator_credit: William Gough, Rex Tasker, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: For hundreds of years, Newfoundlanders have been celebrating Christmas, developing distinct traditions. One of these is figgy duff pudding. A musical group, named after the traditional dessert, play and sing the old songs sung at that time of the year.
results.creator_credit_for_label: William Gough, Rex Tasker, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and National Film Board of Canada
